Description: Fragment of shoulder of North Ionian pottery closed vase, amphora or oinochoe. Clay, dull brownish, with creamy slip on outside; paint black, glossy. Dark purplish-red addition(s). Slight ridge at junction with neck. At top of shoulder, two bands enclose a row of blobs; in frieze below, part of a large half-palmette (horizontal), with flanking volute (probably flanking a lost handle), the preserved petal overpainted dark red.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Royal Ontario Museum, Toronto. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Hayes (1992, 205, N7): "Ware similar to N6; may also have borne black-figure motifs. For similar split palmette motifs see Price (1924) pl. VIII 11-12 and CVA Cambridge 2 pl. XVIII21, Venit Naukratis no. 20 pp. 8-9 (with refs cited) 140, pl.5. Note also Tocra II no. 1977 pl. 9 with p.16 n.3, Schaus, Cyrene Final reports II 51 no. 272 pl. 16."
Bibliographic references: Hayes 1992 / Greek and Greek-Style Pottery and Plain Pottery in the Royal Ontario Museum; Excluding Black-Figure and Red-Figure Vases (p. 205, no N7)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.042)
